{"Date":"2021-08-24T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":56.02000045776367,"Notes":["The exit requirements for Oberlienz expire today, but the rules for Innervillgraten are extended until 1 September.    Reports the Wiener Zeitung: \"The compulsory departure test for the East Tyrolean municipality of Oberlienz, which has been in force since August 11, will expire on Tuesday as planned. However, the compulsory departure test for the community of Innervillgraten, which was imposed at the same time, will be extended up to and including September 1st, the state announced on Monday. The district-wide measures will continue as planned until at least September 1st.\"    Sources:  https://archive.vn/eLwx7 [Wiener Zeitung]  https://archive.vn/Fulk4#selection-815.0-843.4 [current measures in Tyrol]  https://archive.vn/nOY6U [details on requirements]","Vienna introducing policy from 1 September that reduces the period that tests are valid: PCR tests are only valid for 48 hours, antigen tests for 24 hours    \"With the start of school you will \"turn the screws on the test offer\", said Ludwig. The period of validity of the PCR test, the \"gold standard\", will be reduced from 72 to 48 hours on September 1st. For children under the age of 12, it will remain at 72 hours, apparently because there is a nationwide regulation in schools that regulates the City can't change. \"    Source: https://archive.vn/6MmPQ"]}

{"Date":"2021-08-25T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":58.79999923706055,"Notes":["The safety phase at the beginning of school is extended to three weeks (originally two weeks) with students being tested three times a week. What happens after that depends on the risk situation. as informed by the Corona Commission's weekly risk-adjusted 7-day incidence for each district and each federal state.    \"...federal government wants to take temporally and regionally limited measures in the new school year. This is intended to maintain the presence of the schools, and comprehensive school closings are to be avoided.\"    Source: https://archive.vn/mZYFR [Wiener Zeitung reporting on Ministry of Education press conference on schools opening]","\"Furthermore, from August 25, 2021 (until September 1, 2021) for the municipality of Innervillgraten, meetings are only permitted with up to 50 people. In any case, a mask (FFP2) must be worn at permissible gatherings, a 3G verification must be checked and a registration must be carried out. Details can be found in the  relevant ordinance.\"    Source:  https://archive.vn/VwD0y#selection-835.0-857.3"]}

{"Date":"2021-08-27T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":58.79999923706055,"Notes":["Vienna  \"The Viennese PCR test program \"Alles gurgelt\" is being expanded across the board to all schools from the 5th grade.\"    Source: https://archive.vn/Ezj8M"]}

{"Date":"2021-08-30T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":58.79999923706055,"Notes":["\"At the medical universities in Vienna, Innsbruck and Graz and the medical faculty of the University of Linz there should be slightly different requirements for students in terms of vaccination requirements in the coming semester. The medical universities of Vienna and Innsbruck require proof of vaccination from the clinical area onwards, in Graz a 2G rule applies as far as possible and in Linz the 3G rule, according to the APA request.    \"A vaccination certificate for enrollment is not required at any of the four universities. In Vienna and Innsbruck, the 1G rule applies to students, but in the clinical area - i.e. from the first patient contact. This is the case in Vienna at the latest at the end of the second year of study. This means that there is a de facto compulsory vaccination, as all students have to go through this area as part of their training.\"    Wiener Zeitung article    Source: https://archive.vn/00M7J    Source: "]}

{"Date":"2021-09-02T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":58.79999923706055,"Notes":["The resident doctors will also be able to administer the third Corona vaccination - and they will receive a fee of 20 euros for it. The Ministry of Health and the Austrian Medical Association agreed on Thursday.    Source: https://archive.vn/zChGA"]}

{"Date":"2021-09-06T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":58.79999923706055,"Notes":["Schools start on 6 September in Vienna, Lower Austria and Burgenland.  \"There is a safety phase in the first three weeks after the start of school . Due to the current situation, the period has been extended by one week. During the safety phase, all persons outside of the class wear mouth and nose protection. Schoolchildren test themselves three times a week, of which at least once PCR. Teachers and administrative staff test themselves three times, non-vaccinated teaching and administrative staff bring at least one external PCR test.\"    Safe school in autumn - the 4-point plan of the BMBWF  \"The decree on school operation 2021/22 reflects precisely the combination of hygiene / prevention measures and pedagogy and school organization that continuous face-to-face teaching needs in times of the pandemic:    • The three-week security phase at the start of school gives clarity about the infection process at the site, primarily through the close testing of students and teaching and administrative staff, and thus creates a good basis for long-term presence operation.  • Clearly defined risk levels enable regional / location-specific action.  • The individual prevention and hygiene measures of the risk levels are sensitively integrated into the pedagogy and school organization.    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210910180409/https://sichereschule.at/infos/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210910181006/https://www.bmbwf.gv.at/Themen/schule/beratung/corona/sichereschule.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210910181831/https://www.bmbwf.gv.at/Themen/schule/beratung/corona/corona_fua.html","\"The end of the free tests, which has been debated for weeks, could also become an issue [in Wednesday's federal-state summit]: Several ÖVP state chiefs recently called for this in order to motivate more people to vaccinate.    \"The SPÖ-ruled federal states reject this. On Monday, Upper Austria's ÖVP governor Thomas Stelzer spoke out in favor of keeping the free tests.  \"Testing must continue to be possible for everyone free of charge,\" said SPÖ leader Pamela Rendi-Wagner on Monday in Linz. To this end, she urges that the 3G rule \"finally\" also becomes mandatory in companies.\"\"    Source: https://archive.vn/5ASzo"]}

{"Date":"2021-09-08T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":58.79999923706055,"Notes":["The compulsory departure test and measures for the municipality end on Wednesday, September 8, 2021.    \"With the repeal of the ordinance for Innervillgraten, the following measures will be terminated at the end of tomorrow, in addition to the compulsory exit test: Prohibition of events for 50 people or more, compulsory registration for all types of events regardless of their size, FFP2 mask compulsory for all events (outdoors and indoors) as well as in trade.\"    [Previous requirement for reference - https://archive.vn/VwD0y#selection-835.0-857.3]    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210909213429/https://www.tirol.gv.at/presse/meldungen/meldung/coronavirus-massnahmen-fuer-innervillgraten-laufen-morgen-aus/","The compulsory departure test and measures for the municipality end on Wednesday, September 8, 2021.    \"With the repeal of the ordinance for Innervillgraten, the following measures will be terminated at the end of tomorrow, in addition to the compulsory exit test: Prohibition of events for 50 people or more, compulsory registration for all types of events regardless of their size, FFP2 mask compulsory for all events (outdoors and indoors) as well as in trade.\"    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210909213429/https://www.tirol.gv.at/presse/meldungen/meldung/coronavirus-massnahmen-fuer-innervillgraten-laufen-morgen-aus/"]}

{"Date":"2021-09-09T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":49.06999969482422,"Notes":["At work - general guidance  • Workplaces may only be entered by teachers who are in direct contact with students, owners, operators and employees with direct customer contact, persons who are active in dealing with parties in administrative authorities and administrative courts, if they are in contact with students, with customers and with parties wear a mask in closed rooms unless the risk of infection is minimized by other suitable protective measures.  • The obligation to wear a mask does not apply if the persons present a 3-G certificate.  • The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  • By agreement between employers and employees, stricter rules for wearing a mask, an FFP2 mask without an exhalation valve or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard can be made in addition to the arrangements made for wearing a mask.    *Customer areas*  • Mouth and nose protection must be worn in everyday shops such as banks, post offices, pharmacies, drug stores and in grocery stores. A mask in the sense of this ordinance is a close-fitting mechanical protective device (MNS) that covers the mouth and nose area.   • The operator of business premises for the use of body-friendly services may only let in customers if they can present 3-G evidence. The customer must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.    *3-G rule*  The 3-G rule applies in the following areas:  • Gastronomy  • Body-hugging services  • Hotel and lodging  • Leisure facilities ( e.g.  dance schools, zoos)  • Cultural establishments   • Non-public sports facilities  • Meetings (from a number of participants of more than 100 people)  • Trade and consumer fairs, congresses  • Coaches and excursion boats    In addition, the 3G rule continues to  apply in the following areas  and for the following people:  • In the provision of mobile care and support services  • For visitors and employees of retirement and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  • For residents for new admission in old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  • For visitors and employees of hospitals or health resorts  • For employees from other locations where health services are provided.    The following applies as evidence of a low epidemiological risk:  • Evidence of negative testing for SARS-CoV-2  • Medical confirmation of a past infection  • Separation notice  • Vaccination certificate  • Proof of neutralizing antibodies  The certificates for vaccinated, recovered and tested persons are on an equal footing, but differ in their validity period.    *Health and social sector*    Mobile care and support services  • Providers of mobile care and support services require evidence of a low epidemiological risk. If a test certificate is presented, it must be renewed every seven days. If the 3-G proof provided has exceeded its validity, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  • In addition, an MNS must be worn in closed rooms.    Hospitals and health resorts  The following applies to visitors:  • The operator may only admit visitors and accompanying persons if they can provide evidence of a low epidemiological risk (3-G rule). The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  • The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear a mask throughout the visit or stay, provided that there is no other suitable protective device for spatial separation between the resident and the visitor or accompanying person that guarantees the same level of protection.    The following applies to employees:   • Employees need proof of a low epidemiological risk. If a test certificate is presented, it must be renewed every seven days. If the 3-G proof provided has exceeded its validity, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  • Employees must wear an MNS in closed rooms.    The following applies to operators:  ???Operators of hospitals and health resorts have to implement appropriate prevention concepts based on the risk analysis and the state of the art.     Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled  The following applies to visitors:  • The operator may only admit visitors and accompanying persons if they can provide evidence of a low epidemiological risk (3-G rule). The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  • The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear a mask throughout the visit or stay, provided that there is no other suitable protective device for spatial separation between residents and visitors or accompanying persons that provides the same level of protection guaranteed.    The following applies to employees:   • Employees need proof of a low epidemiological risk. If a test certificate is presented, it must be renewed every seven days. If the 3-G proof provided has exceeded its validity, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  • Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.    The following applies to operators:  • Operators of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled have to implement appropriate prevention concepts based on the risk analysis and the state of the art.     Source: https://archive.vn/eHzkb [Corona Ampel Nationwide Measures]","In general  • In principle, there are no longer any maximum limits and capacity restrictions.  • There is no longer a mask requirement at events.  • Meetings of 100 people or more are notifiable. The participants have to show a 3G certificate, which has to be checked by the person responsible. He must also develop and implement a prevention concept and appoint a COVID-19 officer.  • Meetings of 500 people or more must be approved. The 3-G rule also applies here. A prevention concept and the appointment of a COVID-19 officer is required.    Source: https://archive.vn/eHzkb [Corona Ampel Nationwide Measures]","In general  • In principle, there are no longer any maximum limits and capacity restrictions.  • There is no longer a mask requirement at events.  • Meetings of 100 people or more are notifiable. A prevention concept and the appointment of a COVID-19 officer is required.    Source: https://archive.vn/eHzkb [Corona Ampel Nationwide Measures]","Public transport  When using   Taxis and taxi-like establishments Cable cars and rack and pinion railways mass transportation   and in the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures, a mask must be worn in closed rooms.    The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    The following applies to the use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic:  • The operator may only let people in if they can present a 3-G certificate. The person must keep this proof available for the duration of the stay.  • The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.","No internal exit restrictions currently in force.    Source: https://archive.vn/eHzkb#selection-865.0-865.29 [Compulsory test when leaving high incidence areas]","\"Clearance and mouth and nose protection  \"There is no minimum distance of one meter from other people. In all places where the 3-G rule applies, there is no mask requirement. This also applies to employees in those areas in which a 3-G certificate is intended.    \"An MNS must be worn in everyday shops such as banks, post offices, pharmacies, drug stores and in grocery stores. A mask in the sense of this ordinance is a close-fitting mechanical protective device (MNS) that covers the mouth and nose area. \"    NB. In some other contexts a mask is required - for example working in healthcare settings.  Please see original source for further detail.    Source: https://archive.vn/eHzkb#selection-1633.0-1669.129","Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled    The following applies to visitors:  • The operator may only admit visitors and accompanying persons if they can provide evidence of a low epidemiological risk (3-G rule). The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  • The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear a mask throughout the visit or stay, provided that there is no other suitable protective device for spatial separation between residents and visitors or accompanying persons that provides the same level of protection guaranteed.    The following applies to employees:   • Employees need proof of a low epidemiological risk. If a test certificate is presented, it must be renewed every seven days. If the 3-G proof provided has exceeded its validity, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  • Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.    The following applies to operators:  • Operators of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled have to implement appropriate prevention concepts based on the risk analysis and the state of the art.     Source: https://archive.vn/eHzkb"]}

{"Date":"2021-09-13T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":49.06999969482422,"Notes":["Special regulations for Carinthia - Measures for the entire federal state of Carinthia  From September 13, 2021 (until February 13, 2022), additional measures will apply to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in child education and care facilities:  • The 3-G rule applies when entering child education and care facilities, as well as day-care centers and when staying in closed rooms in these facilities. If this is not provided, an MNS must be worn.  • The provider of a facility must implement the requirements of the COVID-19 guidelines for child education and care facilities.  • Activities should be relocated to the open where this appears educationally sensible and organizationally possible.  • The 3-G certificate is a prerequisite for caring for children in after-school care centers. If this cannot be achieved, the child has to wear an MNS.    Source:  https://archive.vn/drFIv [Carinthia]"]}

{"Date":"2021-09-15T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":51.849998474121094,"Notes":["\"The Ninja Pass is now valid as proof of test for the entire week, regardless of the period of validity of the individual partial tests.\"    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210916133751/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html","The 3G rule applies to gatherings of 25 people or more (previously the limit was 100 people) as Level 1 rules introduced \"Due to the current workload, the level 1 measures came into effect on September 15 .\"    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210916133751/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html","\"In addition, wearing an FFP 2 mask is becoming an obligation for unvaccinated people in retail outlets ; However, it is recommended that people who have been vaccinated also wear an FFP 2 mask! The police will also carry out random checks.\"    \"An FFP 2 mask is mandatory wherever mouth and nose protection is currently provided ( food retailers including sales outlets of food producers as well as petrol stations with associated sales outlets for food, pharmacies, banks, post offices , public transport)    \"For those who have not been vaccinated or who have not recovered It is mandatory for people to wear an FFP 2 mask in the entire retail trade, day care facilities for the elderly and in the disabled area, as well as cultural facilities (museums, libraries, theaters, cinemas, etc.)\"    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210916133751/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html  ","In addition to other measures:  \"For those who have not been vaccinated or who have not recovered It is mandatory for people to wear an FFP 2 mask in the entire retail trade, day care facilities for the elderly and in the disabled area, as well as cultural facilities (museums, libraries, theaters, cinemas, etc.)\"    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210916133751/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html","8th amendment to the 2nd COVID-19 opening regulation  With the 8th amendment of the 2nd COVID-19 Opening Ordinance, the ordinance is renamed the 2nd COVID-19 Measures Ordinance  .    With this amendment, the following regulations will come into force nationwide from September 15 :  • Antigen tests are only valid for 24 hours after the test has been taken  • An FFP 2 mask is mandatory wherever mouth and nose protection is currently provided ( food retailers including sales outlets of food producers as well as petrol stations with associated sales outlets for food, pharmacies, banks, post offices , public transport)  • For those who have not been vaccinated or who have not recovered It is mandatory for people to wear an FFP 2 mask in the entire retail trade, day care facilities for the elderly and in the disabled area, as well as cultural facilities (museums, libraries, theaters, cinemas, etc.)  • The 3-G rule applies to gatherings of 25 or more people  • The currently applicable event rules will be extended until October 13, 2021  • The Ninja Pass is now valid as proof of test for the entire week, regardless of the period of validity of the individual partial tests  • Vaccinated and convalescent people are treated equally with regard to post-gastronomy    Validity of the vaccination  So far, evidence of a second vaccination was valid for 270 days. In the future, second vaccinations as well as each subsequent vaccination will be recognized up to 360 days after administration.  [Further details included in source link.]    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210916133751/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html"]}

{"Date":"2021-09-16T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":51.849998474121094,"Notes":["\"Job seekers cannot refuse a reasonable position placed via the Public Employment Service (AMS) because the employer requires a Covid-19 vaccination. The AMS will not force anyone to have a vaccination, but an application for a job cannot be rejected simply because the applicant has not been vaccinated, the Ministry of Labor said about the \"standard\".\"    Source: https://archive.vn/J0Dc4 [Wiener Zeitung]"]}

{"Date":"2021-09-18T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":60.189998626708984,"Notes":["Compulsory test upon departure - Braunau district  From September 18, 2021, the following applies to the entire Braunau district: Leaving the area - with a few exceptions - is only permitted with a 3-G certificate. Evidence is a negative PCR test (not older than 72 hours), a negative antigen test (not older than 24 hours), recovered persons (up to 180 days after confirmed infection), persons who have proof of neutralizing antibodies (not older than 90 days), people who are already fully immunized and people who have recovered with at least one Covid vaccination. Details can be found in the relevant ordinance.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/ZOLww#selection-767.0-807.2 [current measures in Upper Austria]  https://archive.vn/pUbol [relevant ordinance] "]}

{"Date":"2021-09-23T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":60.189998626708984,"Notes":["The 3-G rule applies in the following areas:  • Gastronomy  • Body-hugging services  • Hotel and lodging  • Leisure facilities (e.g. dance schools, zoos)  • Cultural establishments   • Non-public sports facilities  • Meetings (from a number of participants of more than 100 people)  • Trade and consumer fairs, congresses  • Coaches and excursion boats    In addition, the 3G rule continues to apply in the following areas and for the following people:  • In the provision of mobile care and support services  • For visitors and employees of retirement and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  • For residents for new admission in old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  • For visitors and employees of hospitals or health resorts  • For employees from other locations where health services are provided.    The following applies as evidence of a low epidemiological risk:  • Evidence of negative testing for SARS-CoV-2  • Medical confirmation of a past infection  • Separation notice  • Vaccination certificate  • Proof of neutralizing antibodies  The certificates for vaccinated, recovered and tested persons are on an equal footing, but differ in their validity period.      At work  • Workplaces may only be entered by teachers who are in direct contact with students, owners, operators and employees with direct customer contact, persons who are active in dealing with parties in administrative authorities and administrative courts, if they are in contact with students, with customers and with parties wear a mask in closed rooms unless the risk of infection is minimized by other suitable protective measures.  • The obligation to wear a mask does not apply if the persons present a 3-G certificate.  • The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  • By agreement between employers and employees, stricter rules for wearing a mask, an FFP2 mask without an exhalation valve or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard can be made in addition to the arrangements made for wearing a mask.    Customer areas  • An FFP2 mask must be worn in everyday shops such as banks, post offices, pharmacies, drugstores and in grocery stores.   • When entering and driving in other customer areas as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected operating facilities (e.g. shopping centers, market halls), customers who have not been vaccinated or have recovered must wear an FFP2 mask.  • The operator of business premises for the use of body-friendly services may only let in customers if they can present 3-G evidence. The customer must have this proof available for the duration of the stay. The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  The following applies to the use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic:    The operator may only let people in if they can present a 3-G certificate. The person must keep this proof available for the duration of the stay.  The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/hHIEh [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/lvK8E [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/diWQJ [Entire legal provision for the 2nd COVID-19 Measures Ordinance, version dated September 23, 2021]","5th amendment to the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021  The 5th amendment to the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 brings with it some changes:    • So far, a second vaccination was valid for nine months. In the future, second vaccinations as well as each subsequent vaccination will be recognized upon entry even if they were up to 360 days ago. As evidence of a low epidemiological risk, the 3rd vaccination (or the 2nd vaccination for single vaccines and those who have recovered with a vaccination bite) is now included. There must be at least 14 days between the 1st and 2nd vaccination and at least 120 days between the 2nd and 3rd vaccination.  • Those who have recovered are treated on an equal footing with those who have been fully immunized.  • There is a tightening of the entry regulations from several countries: This affects the USA, the Western Balkans states Serbia, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Kosovo and Albania. In addition, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Brunei, Israel, Japan and Thailand will be removed from Appendix 1. For these countries, the entry regulations of the other states and areas apply again .  • There are also changes to the list of virus variant states: Eswatini, Lesotho, Malawi, Mozambique, Namibia, Zimbabwe and Uruguay will be deleted from this list. Chile, Costa Rica and Suriname are new to this list. For countries that are on the list of virus variant states, extensive entry restrictions and mandatory quarantine still apply.  • Spain is no longer subject to any special provisions for entry by air according to § 5a. For entries from Spain, the regulations in Appendix 1 apply.  • The validity of the regulation will be extended from September 20 to October 31, 2021.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/hHIEh#selection-2005.0-2061.75 [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/5lkGY [FAQ : Entry into Austria]","An FFP 2 mask is mandatory wherever mouth and nose protection is currently provided (food retailers including sales outlets of food producers as well as petrol stations with associated sales outlets for food, pharmacies, banks, post offices, public transport)    In addition, the wearing of an FFP 2 mask is becoming an obligation for unvaccinated, unrecovered people ; For vaccinated and recovered people, however, wearing an FFP 2 mask is also recommended! The police will also carry out random checks.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/hHIEh [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/lvK8E [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/diWQJ [Entire legal provision for the 2nd COVID-19 Measures Ordinance, version dated September 23, 2021]","Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled  The following applies to visitors:    The operator may only admit visitors and accompanying persons if they can provide evidence of a low epidemiological risk (3-G rule). The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask throughout the visit or stay, provided that there is no other suitable protective device for spatial separation between residents and visitors or accompanying persons same level of protection guaranteed.  Visitors who have not been vaccinated or have recovered must wear an FFP2 mask.  The following applies to employees:     Employees need proof of a low epidemiological risk. If a test certificate is presented, it must be renewed every seven days. If the 3-G proof provided has exceeded its validity, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.  The following applies to operators:    Operators of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled have to implement appropriate prevention concepts based on the risk analysis and the state of the art.     Source: https://archive.vn/hHIEh [Nationwide measures]    Source: "]}

{"Date":"2021-09-30T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":51.849998474121094,"Notes":["Special regulations for Styria  Measures for the entire federal state of Styria    From September 30, 2021 (until July 8, 2022), additional measures will apply to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in child education and care facilities:  • In order to minimize the risk of infection, the provider must implement the hygiene concepts and guidelines of the State of Styria, which include, in particular, requirements for ventilating, cleaning and disinfecting rooms as well as general hygiene measures for children, staff, external persons and accompanying persons.  • Activities should be relocated to the open where this appears educationally sensible and organizationally possible.  • External persons must wear an FFP2 mask in the facility.  • A valid Corona test pass (documentation issued by the school on the evidence provided of a low epidemiological risk) is required to care for school-age children in after-school care centers. If no corona test pass can be presented, 3-G proof must be provided when entering the facility.    Source: https://archive.vn/aPY6X#selection-935.0-1043.95 [Special regulations for Styria]"]}

{"Date":"2021-10-01T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":51.849998474121094,"Notes":["\"From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location. Further information can be found on the website of the  Federal Ministry of Education, Science and Research (BMBWF).\"    *Universities*  Does the “3-G rule” - tested, recovered, vaccinated - also apply to universities and colleges?Inhalt zuklappen  In any case, it is recommended that the so-called \"3-G rule\" also authorize access to universities and colleges. As in other areas of life, those who have been tested, recovered and vaccinated should be granted access to the campus. For this, the current legal basis, the 2nd COVID-19 University Act , has been extended to the upcoming winter semester 2021/22 until February 28, 2022 and adjusted accordingly. The 3G rule is particularly relevant for participation in face-to-face courses, face-to-face exams or participation in selection, aptitude and admission procedures on site . The proven approach remains that the University and college managements are responsible for determining the specific corona measures at their locations. They know the respective conditions and requirements on site best. However, they have to guarantee the applicable level of protection, for which the current, general corona protection and hygiene measures offer a valuable basis.     Therefore, please inform yourself directly at your respective university or college how they organize their teaching and examination operations and which Corona measures they intend to take.    The 3-G rule states:     The 2nd COVID-19 Opening Ordinance defines precise criteria as to when one belongs to the group of people who have a \"low epidemiological risk\".   - Anyone who has been vaccinated with a centrally approved COVID-19 vaccine is considered vaccinated. The first vaccination counts from the 22nd day after the 1st prick for a maximum of three months from the time of vaccination. After the 2nd bite you are immunized for a total of 20 days. Vaccines for which only one vaccination is intended (e.g. from Johnson & Johnson) are valid from the 22nd day after the vaccination for a total of 270 days. This also applies to people who can be proven to have recovered as soon as they have received the first stitch.   - As tested applies to those who can provide evidence of a negative PCR test or a negative antigen test. PCR tests are valid for 72 hours from the time the sample is taken, and antigen tests for 48 hours if performed by an authorized body. Self-tests that are recorded in an official data processing system in the federal states are valid for 24 hours. In addition, there are exceptionally supervised point-of-sale tests for one-time entry of sports facilities, business premises, restaurants, hotels or an event.  - As recovered applies to those who can present a separation notice of a SARS-COV-2 infection or a medical confirmation within the last six months. Alternatively, a corresponding antibody test can be presented, which, however, must not be older than three months.  You can find more detailed information about the 3-G rule and the other applicable protective and hygiene measures on the website of the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection (BMSGPK) .     Sources:   https://archive.vn/MVQ1H [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211004164552/https://www.bmbwf.gv.at/Themen/HS-Uni/Aktuelles/corona/corona_faq.html  https://archive.vn/drFIv [Special regulations for Carinthia]","At work  • Workplaces may only be entered by teachers who are in direct contact with students, owners, operators and employees with direct customer contact, persons who are active in dealing with parties in administrative authorities and administrative courts, if they are in contact with students, with customers and with parties wear a mask in closed rooms unless the risk of infection is minimized by other suitable protective measures.  • The obligation to wear a mask does not apply if the persons present a 3-G certificate.  • The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  • By agreement between employers and employees, stricter rules for wearing a mask, an FFP2 mask without an exhalation valve or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard can be made in addition to the arrangements made for wearing a mask.    Customer areas  • An FFP2 mask must be worn in everyday shops such as banks, post offices, pharmacies, drugstores and in grocery stores.   • When entering and driving in other customer areas as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected operating facilities (e.g. shopping centers, market halls), customers who have not been vaccinated or have recovered must wear an FFP2 mask.  • The operator of business premises for the use of body-friendly services may only let in customers if they can present 3-G evidence. The customer must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.    3-G rule  The 3-G rule applies in the following areas:  • Gastronomy  • Body-hugging services  • Hotel and lodging  • Leisure facilities (e.g. dance schools, zoos)  • Cultural establishments   • Non-public sports facilities  • Meetings (from a number of participants of more than 100 people)  • Trade and consumer fairs, congresses  • Coaches and excursion boats    *Leisure, sport and culture*    Leisure  Leisure facilities are businesses and facilities that serve entertainment, amusement or recreation. Leisure facilities are in particular:   • Fairgrounds, amusement and amusement parks  • Baths and facilities   • Dance schools  • Betting offices, slot machines, amusement arcades and casinos  • Show mines  • Facilities for the practice of prostitution  • Indoorspielplätze  • Paintballanlagen  • Museum railways  • Animal parks, zoos and botanical gardens    The following applies in this area:  • Customers must show a 3-G certificate, which must be kept available for the duration of their stay.  • Every leisure company must create a prevention concept and appoint a COVID-19 officer.    Culture  • Unvaccinated persons must wear an FFP2 mask in museums, art halls and cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries and archives.  • For cultural institutions in which mainly meetings take place, such as in particular theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas, a 3G certificate, a COVID-19 officer and a prevention concept are required.    Sport  • The 3-G rule applies to sports facilities. The proof must be kept ready for the duration of the stay.   • All sports are permitted, and contact sports are again possible.  • Operators of non-public sports facilities must create a Covid-19 prevention concept and appoint a Covid-19 officer.  • There are detailed regulations for the exercise of sports by top athletes.    *Gastronomy and accommodation*    Gastronomy  When visiting a restaurant, the following rules must be observed:  • 3-G rule (see above)    The operators of catering establishments must also ensure the following:  • Self-service buffets can be operated subject to hygiene requirements.  • Every catering business must create a prevention concept and appoint a Covid-19 officer.  • Mandatory collection of customer data.  • The 3-G rule does not apply to the pick-up of food and drinks, as well as snack bars and catering stands.     Night gastronomy  • Access to the night catering is possible for vaccinated and convalescent people, as well as people with a current negative PCR test result (max. 72 hours old). The proof must be kept ready for the duration of the stay. The new restrictions on night dining do not apply to gatherings such as tent parties.     Accommodation  • The accommodation establishments are allowed to reopen under Covid conditions. To do this, the operators must create a COVID-19 prevention concept and appoint a Covid-19 officer.  • The 3-G rule applies when entering for the first time. If the validity expires during the stay, a new proof must be provided.  • For the use of the culinary offer in hotels and accommodation establishments, the regulations of the catering trade apply. The 3-G rule must be observed for the use of gastronomy, wellness and fitness offers.  • Mandatory collection of customer data.    Source: https://archive.vn/MVQ1H  [Nationwide measures]","In general:  • In principle, there are no longer any maximum limits and capacity restrictions.  • There is no longer a mask requirement at events.  • Meetings with more than 25 participants are only permitted on the condition that the person responsible for the meeting only allows the participants to enter if they can provide proof of 3G.  • Meetings of 100 people or more are notifiable. The participants have to show a 3G certificate, which has to be checked by the person responsible. He must also develop and implement a prevention concept and appoint a COVID-19 officer.  • Meetings of 500 people or more must be approved. The 3-G rule also applies here. A prevention concept and the appointment of a COVID-19 officer is required. Source: https://archive.vn/MVQ1H  [Nationwide measures]","Public transport  An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using taxis and taxi-like companies, cable cars and rack and pinion railways for mass transportation and in the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.  • The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    The following applies to the use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic:  • The operator may only let people in if they can present a 3-G certificate. The person must keep this proof available for the duration of the stay.  • The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Source: https://archive.vn/MVQ1H  [Nationwide measures]","The 5th amendment to the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 brings with it some changes:  • So far, a second vaccination was valid for nine months. In the future, second vaccinations as well as each subsequent vaccination will be recognized upon entry even if they were up to 360 days ago. As evidence of a low epidemiological risk, the 3rd vaccination (or the 2nd vaccination for single vaccines and those who have recovered with a vaccination bite) is now included. There must be at least 14 days between the 1st and 2nd vaccination and at least 120 days between the 2nd and 3rd vaccination.    • Those who have recovered are treated on an equal footing with those who have been fully immunized.    • There is a tightening of the entry regulations from several countries: This affects the USA, the Western Balkans states Serbia, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Kosovo and Albania. In addition, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Brunei, Israel, Japan and Thailand will be removed from Appendix 1. For these countries, the entry regulations of the other states and areas apply again .    • There are also changes to the list of virus variant states: Eswatini, Lesotho, Malawi, Mozambique, Namibia, Zimbabwe and Uruguay will be deleted from this list. Chile, Costa Rica and Suriname are new to this list. For countries that are on the list of virus variant states, extensive entry restrictions and mandatory quarantine still apply.    • Spain is no longer subject to any special provisions for entry by air according to § 5a. For entries from Spain, the regulations in Appendix 1 apply.    • The validity of the regulation will be extended from September 20 to October 31, 2021.    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20211004173733/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]","Clearance and mouth and nose protection  • There is no minimum distance of one meter from other people. In all places where the 3-G rule applies, there is no mask requirement. This also applies to employees in those areas in which a 3-G certificate is intended.    • In everyday shops such as banks, post offices, pharmacies, drugstores and grocery stores, an FFP2 mask must be worn again instead of the previous     MNS wearing obligation.  • In addition, the wearing of an FFP2 mask in trade and cultural institutions is becoming an obligation for unvaccinated people. Wearing an FFP2 mask is recommended for people who have been vaccinated.    • Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 are also allowed to wear an MNS. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS.    Source:  https://archive.vn/MVQ1H#selection-1661.0-1713.47 [Nationwide measures]","For the federal state of Vienna, the following additional, stricter measures apply from October 1 to October 31 inclusive.    Bedside hospitals and health resorts  • Visits are limited to one person per day and patient.  • Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to provide bedside hospitals as well as old people's and nursing homes with proof of a negative PCR test (in exceptional cases an antigen test can be carried out when starting work and a PCR test has to be carried out), with proof of a vaccination, international vaccination pass, segregation notice and proof enter via neutralizing antibodies. Once a week, all employees, owners and operators have to submit proof of a negative PCR test. An FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must also be worn in closed rooms.    General regulations  Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled    The following applies to visitors:  • The operator may only admit visitors and accompanying persons if they can provide evidence of a low epidemiological risk (3-G rule). The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  • The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask throughout the visit or stay, provided that there is no other suitable protective device for spatial separation between residents and visitors or accompanying persons same level of protection guaranteed.  • Visitors who have not been vaccinated or have recovered must wear an FFP2 mask.    The following applies to employees:   • Employees need proof of a low epidemiological risk. If a test certificate is presented, it must be renewed every seven days. If the 3-G proof provided has exceeded its validity, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  • Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.    The following applies to operators:  • Operators of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled have to implement appropriate prevention concepts based on the risk analysis and the state of the art.     Sources:   https://archive.vn/rdQdH#selection-1115.0-1151.107 [Special regulations for Vienna]  https://archive.vn/MVQ1H  [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/xAEVE [Consolidated federal law - section 23 shows amendments]","Special regulations for Vienna  Measures for the entire state of Vienna    For the federal state of Vienna, the following additional, stricter measures apply from October 1 to October 31 inclusive  :  3-G rule  • In Vienna, this applies to children from the age of 6.  • Self-tests for personal use, which are recorded in an official data acquisition system, are not regulated as approved tests in the ordinance.  • An antigen test can be performed by any authorized facility. Such a facility is in particular a test street, a hospital, a cold box, a pharmacy or a medical practice.   • The Corona test pass in accordance with the COVID-19 School Ordinance 2021/2022 is also valid as 3-G proof.  • The 3-G rule applies to entering and driving certain locations and operating facilities (such as sports halls,  outdoor swimming pools, zoos, cinemas, etc.)  as well as using certain means of transport (coaches and excursion boats)  .   • Since September 1st, PCR tests are only valid for 48 hours as entry tests for people over the age of 12; from October 1st, antigen tests  are  no longer considered entry tests.    Bedside hospitals and health resorts  • Visits are limited to one person per day and patient.  • Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to provide bedside hospitals as well as old people's and nursing homes with proof of a negative PCR test (in exceptional cases an antigen test can be carried out when starting work and a PCR test has to be carried out), with proof of a vaccination, international vaccination pass, segregation notice and proof enter via neutralizing antibodies. Once a week, all employees, owners and operators have to submit proof of a negative PCR test. An FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must also be worn in closed rooms.    Night gastronomy   • Access to the night catering is only possible with proof of vaccination, international vaccination pass, separation notice and proof of neutralizing antibodies.   • A negative PCR test is no longer possible for access.    Meetings  • For meetings  with more than 500 participants, access is only possible with proof of a vaccination, international vaccination pass, separation notice and proof of neutralizing antibodies. A negative PCR test is no longer possible for entry.    Mask requirement  • In Vienna, the mask requirement applies in museums, art halls and cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries and archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas, as well as institutions for religious practice.    Registration requirement  • In restaurants and hotels, non-public sports and leisure facilities and at meetings with more than 100 people, the contact details of visitors must be collected.    Source: https://archive.vn/rdQdH#selection-757.0-1207.11 [Special regulations for Vienna]"]}
